intro: Acronia cuzcoensis, commonly known as the Cusco acronia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Peruvian Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silky hair, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Acronia cuzcoensis is often found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the cool, dry conditions of its high-altitude habitat.
